Disclosure 402-1 Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Unnamed: 4: The minimum number of weeksÃ¢ÂÂ notice typically provided to employees and their representatives prior to the implementation of significant operational changes that could substantially affect them is four weeks.\nCadia: There are general consultation provisions under the Cadia EA (2021-2025) (p.10-11) but there is no specification on the number of weeks. Unnamed: 2: Disclosure 403-1 Occupational health and safety management system
Unnamed: 3: Has an occupational health and safety management system has been implemented?
Unnamed: 6: The system is implemented in line with the legal requirements in the locations in which we operate, including Australian Work Health and Safety Acts and regulations; New South Wales Work Health and Safety (Mines and Petroleum Sites) Act and Regulation, Western Australian Mines Safety and Inspection Act and Regulations; Canada Mines Act and Health Safety and Reclamation Code for Mines in British Columbia and Papua New Guinea Mining Safety Act and Regulations.

Unnamed: 3: Has the system been implemented because of legal requirements? If YES, please list these requirements.
Unnamed: 6: The system is implemented in line with the legal requirements in the locations in which we operate, including Australian Work Health and Safety Acts and regulations; New South Wales Work Health and Safety (Mines and Petroleum Sites) Act and Regulation, Western Australian Mines Safety and Inspection Act and Regulations; Canada Mines Act and Health Safety and Reclamation Code for Mines in British Columbia and Papua New Guinea Mining Safety Act and Regulations.

Unnamed: 3: Has the system has been implemented based on recognized risk management and/or management system standards/guidelines? If YES, please list these requirements.
Unnamed: 6: The Newcrest Health Safety Environment Management System (HSEMS) aligns with the requirements of ISO 45001 Occupational health and safety management systems and ISO 31000 Risk Management.

Unnamed: 3: Describe the scope of workers, activities, and workplaces covered by the occupational health and safety management system, and an explanation of whether and, if so, why any workers, activities, or workplaces are not covered.
Unnamed: 6: The Standards apply to all managed Newcrest sites throughout the entire lifecycle, including exploration, construction, development, operation and closure. They apply to all Newcrest employees, contractors, subcontractors and visitors. Joint ventures, where Newcrest is not the managing entity, and external independent contractor facilities, are not covered by the HSEMS.
